wikipedia_page.main:
Hoël Carlos Pattisson (5 September 1905 – 10 July 1979) was an English cricketer who made one appearance in first-class cricket in 1937.
Educated at Rugby School, Pattisson made his only appearance in first-class cricket in 1937 when he was selected to play for the Free Foresters against Oxford University at the Oxford. He played as a wicket-keeper in the match, as well as captaining the team. He was dismissed bowled by Randle Darwall-Smith without scoring in the Free Foresters first-innings, while in their second-innings he scored 20 runs before being bowled by Bill Murray-Wood. Oxford University won the match by 10 wickets.He died at Playden, Sussex on 10 July 1979.
